### What is this?

Hub is the place to talk about whatever you want! Nothing is off topic here. You can do things such as sharing asking questions, sharing images, making a joke, ranting, sharing a meme, sharing any piece of info you want to share, and much more.

---
---

### Rules:  
  
**1, Follow Ruqqus site-wide rules**  

Your content must comply with the [Ruqqus Content Policy](https://ruqqus.com/help/rules).  
 
Violations will be reported to the admins and offenders will be exiled.  

---

**2, No spam**

Flooding this guild with content that doesn't contribute to any discussion or breaks the rules counts as spam.

---

**3, Don't be an asshole**

 - Be nice to your fellow users
 - Don't drag discussion down the Pyramid of Debate.

parent.body:
I said the N letter with the Netflix logo at the same time as someone else was also sending the N letter so they just straight up banned both of us lmao. No warning, just ban. Kinda asinine without a good set of rules, if they don't want media uploads, they should disable it. It's like the admins have never used discord before or something and don't know how to disable all media. If it's against the rules to say the leter N, it should be clear. If it's against the rules to send a link of the netflix logo, they should disable all media. Not just this shit non-communication made up rules as we go along. Kinda retarded that I got banned without warning, I mean a kick wouldve sufficed and I woulda got the message, but what can ya do. Banned. 

That's why i wouldn't mind being able to create a chatroom/PM type of deal with select users on Ruqqus. 

I was in the server 2 days before the Reddit ban happened and the influx of users came.
parent.body_html:
I said the N letter with the Netflix logo at the same time as someone else was also sending the N letter so they just straight up banned both of us lmao. No warning, just ban. Kinda asinine without a good set of rules, if they don't want media uploads, they should disable it. It's like the admins have never used discord before or something and don't know how to disable all media. If it's against the rules to say the leter N, it should be clear. If it's against the rules to send a link of the netflix logo, they should disable all media. Not just this shit non-communication made up rules as we go along. Kinda retarded that I got banned without warning, I mean a kick wouldve sufficed and I woulda got the message, but what can ya do. Banned.

That's why i wouldn't mind being able to create a chatroom/PM type of deal with select users on Ruqqus.

I was in the server 2 days before the Reddit ban happened and the influx of users came.

body:
I made that post. Yeah, they're usually very helpful otherwise but when it comes to anything having to do with the Discord for some reason they just troll anyone who has concerns about it. Seems like they don't think anyone besides the mods is welcome to give their input about the Discord server, and they don't even listen to those few mods a lot of the times (the biggest difference is they at least take them seriously). If you want unbanned or at least an answer try @AngstKitten, @Meguminnnn, or one of the mods instead, they're usually good about this.

It's just not like the admins to be like this imo, maybe there's more going on behind the scenes and Discord employees are actually mandating this strange new attitude about moderation and won't let the admins or mods tell anyone lest the server get deleted (which is probably inevitable at some point anyway). I know they've all been extremely paranoid about that happening so it's definitely possible.
body_html:
I made that post. Yeah, they're usually very helpful otherwise but when it comes to anything having to do with the Discord for some reason they just troll anyone who has concerns about it. Seems like they don't think anyone besides the mods is welcome to give their input about the Discord server, and they don't even listen to those few mods a lot of the times (the biggest difference is they at least take them seriously). If you want unbanned or at least an answer try @AngstKitten, @Meguminnnn, or one of the mods instead, they're usually good about this.

It's just not like the admins to be like this imo, maybe there's more going on behind the scenes and Discord employees are actually mandating this strange new attitude about moderation and won't let the admins or mods tell anyone lest the server get deleted (which is probably inevitable at some point anyway). I know they've all been extremely paranoid about that happening so it's definitely possible.

body: I don't believe you can. If you contact the guildmasters of the other guild, you can kick the posts from your guild and have them yank them into theirs, and then set your guild to private, or ask the admins to ban it with a link directing to the other guild.
body_html: I don't believe you can. If you contact the guildmasters of the other guild, you can kick the posts from your guild and have them yank them into theirs, and then set your guild to private, or ask the admins to ban it with a link directing to the other guild.

post.body:
Gentlemen (and ladies),

I made a guild for British Politics and it was pointed out earlier today that there is another guild, slightly more popular, on the same topic. I didn't know the other guild, and there are talks about unifying them.

But there are no tools that I can see to do it, so I wonder if there is any kind of precedence for this on Ruqqus, or whether that's in the roadmap or not or if it can be done behind the curtains while we don't have tools to do it ourselves.

Any suggestions?

These are our guilds:

+BritishPolitics

+ukpolitics

(I'm still waiting for feedback from the other guildmaster, who seems to have been absent for a while.)

Thank you!
post.body_html:
Gentlemen (and ladies),

I made a guild for British Politics and it was pointed out earlier today that there is another guild, slightly more popular, on the same topic. I didn't know the other guild, and there are talks about unifying them.

But there are no tools that I can see to do it, so I wonder if there is any kind of precedence for this on Ruqqus, or whether that's in the roadmap or not or if it can be done behind the curtains while we don't have tools to do it ourselves.

Any suggestions?

These are our guilds:

+BritishPolitics

+ukpolitics

(I'm still waiting for feedback from the other guildmaster, who seems to have been absent for a while.)

Thank you!
post.title: Merging and redirecting guilds

post.body:
Just wanted to share some thought with anyone who cares to listen.

I've had time to test the waters and like what I see so far. Frankly I was surprised to find as robust of a community as exists here on ruqqus. 

I'm not surprised to find that the discourse is mostly dominated by right wing thought as those were the subreddits banned by reddit. There is some left wing thought here so it's far from an echo chamber. I'm curious to see how things shake out in the months or years to come.

I like the anti-censorship stance the creators have taken. Of course there are limits to the speech even here, and some speech that's legally allowed in the US is disallowed here. That's the reality of having an online service these days. Say that which others don't like, or even allow others to say it on your site and you will find yourself without a web host or a payment processor. It's not surprising to see some guilds already banned that did not violate US law. I will watch closely how much speech this site allows, especially as it gets bigger. I wouldn't be surprised to see the site owners face tough choices even in the near future.

I tested the waters with some racial slurs and unpopular opinions and for the most part was not received too negatively. I don't know if any of my comments got removed by guildmasters. If they have, I'd like to be notified of it. 

As far as usability I like the mobile pages for the most part. The buttons could be bigger. I'd also like to see the Context button moved out of the ... Menu.

Site performance has been on the slow side. Waiting several seconds for each page to load feels like too long. This needs to be improved.

I've enjoyed the discussions so far and hope to see you all some other time.
post.body_html:
Just wanted to share some thought with anyone who cares to listen.

I've had time to test the waters and like what I see so far. Frankly I was surprised to find as robust of a community as exists here on ruqqus.

I'm not surprised to find that the discourse is mostly dominated by right wing thought as those were the subreddits banned by reddit. There is some left wing thought here so it's far from an echo chamber. I'm curious to see how things shake out in the months or years to come.

I like the anti-censorship stance the creators have taken. Of course there are limits to the speech even here, and some speech that's legally allowed in the US is disallowed here. That's the reality of having an online service these days. Say that which others don't like, or even allow others to say it on your site and you will find yourself without a web host or a payment processor. It's not surprising to see some guilds already banned that did not violate US law. I will watch closely how much speech this site allows, especially as it gets bigger. I wouldn't be surprised to see the site owners face tough choices even in the near future.

I tested the waters with some racial slurs and unpopular opinions and for the most part was not received too negatively. I don't know if any of my comments got removed by guildmasters. If they have, I'd like to be notified of it.

As far as usability I like the mobile pages for the most part. The buttons could be bigger. I'd also like to see the Context button moved out of the ... Menu.

Site performance has been on the slow side. Waiting several seconds for each page to load feels like too long. This needs to be improved.

I've enjoyed the discussions so far and hope to see you all some other time.

post.body:
Basically the title. It's nice to see more information than just the difference between the number of upvotes and downvotes. It shows if an issue is polarizing and can people react differently to it with seeing if lots of people both agree and disagree. Reddit used to work that way, and it would be a nice feature. 

Also I'm not promoting the downvote button as a disagree button since it shouldn't be used that way, but people do it anyway.
post.body_html:
Basically the title. It's nice to see more information than just the difference between the number of upvotes and downvotes. It shows if an issue is polarizing and can people react differently to it with seeing if lots of people both agree and disagree. Reddit used to work that way, and it would be a nice feature.

Also I'm not promoting the downvote button as a disagree button since it shouldn't be used that way, but people do it anyway.
post.title: It would be nice to see the total number of upvotes/downvotes a comment/post has

body: The thing about reposting on reddit is, most people *didn't* see it the last time. Getting all worked up because someone posts something that someone else did 10 years ago isn't worth it imo. They probably didn't even know it was posted before.

body: Just capping guilds is not quite going to cut it. The admins have to stay vigilant that they never arbitrarily hand certain users or guilds special privileges or communication without a way for others to gain said status. Otherwise the guild cap wouldn't matter because 1) they would have site-wide influence, and 2) they could easily spread out the guildmaster positions amongst themselves.
body_html: Just capping guilds is not quite going to cut it. The admins have to stay vigilant that they never arbitrarily hand certain users or guilds special privileges or communication without a way for others to gain said status. Otherwise the guild cap wouldn't matter because 1) they would have site-wide influence, and 2) they could easily spread out the guildmaster positions amongst themselves.

body:
Yes, but you'd have to contact Reddit Inc. in order to have it done.

I wouldn't recommend doing that or even deleting your account though. First of all, it can't be undone. Second, if you delete your account all your previous conversations will become confusing because there's no way to tell deleted users apart. If you wipe your account I would guess they would all be lost completely.
body_html:
Yes, but you'd have to contact Reddit Inc. in order to have it done.

I wouldn't recommend doing that or even deleting your account though. First of all, it can't be undone. Second, if you delete your account all your previous conversations will become confusing because there's no way to tell deleted users apart. If you wipe your account I would guess they would all be lost completely.

parent.body_html: This is the post that pointed me to ruqqus - pretty sure I'm just going to delete my account on reddit. Is it possible with GDPR to demand immediate deletion of my user data?

post.body:
> I know that all of us are here for freedom of speech and open discussions. That's why you came here in the first place.

> However, I've recently been contacted by reddit admins regarding the moderation level of this sub, which leads me to believe that people have been contacting reddit admins (for some godforsaken reason) about it.

> This is not a preferable outcome for several reasons:

> 1) it's a known quantity that reddit has become neolib-leaning. Whether you agree with it or not, there is a certain agenda and stance being pushed, by censoring and outright deleting various subs. The more attention you draw to this sub, the greater the likelihood that this sub itself will be taken down. Even if it's only a few bad posters. Even if the 136,990 other users are not like them.

> 2) the single biggest reason why this sub has become so successful is because of you guys. We, the moderators, did not create or even guide the development of this sub into this vibrant, active community of pro-2A and pro gun people. You did. Not even five years ago, this sub was a tiny 10k subscriber community of mainly disgruntled r / guns users. Now it is where it is today. I don't want to see this sub turn into something it shouldn't be, because a handful of users wanted a policed sub like the other gun related ones.

> 3) parallel to points 1 and 2, seeking a heavier hand in moderation means that content will not be dictated by the community, but by what moderators deem acceptable. I'm not sure if any of you were here about 3 years ago, but we had an incident in which there was essentially an attempt to dictate what you can and cannot say, based arbitrarily on what two mods thought they wanted to see.

> As a moderator with admin privileges, I can do my best to try to vet limited mods as such, but I would much rather have the community self-police. If you need moderator assistance with regards to content that violates reddit rules (in a strict sense, I don't want to remove content that fits the rules but not your preferences), contact me directly.
post.body_html:
I know that all of us are here for freedom of speech and open discussions. That's why you came here in the first place.

However, I've recently been contacted by reddit admins regarding the moderation level of this sub, which leads me to believe that people have been contacting reddit admins (for some godforsaken reason) about it.

This is not a preferable outcome for several reasons:

  1. it's a known quantity that reddit has become neolib-leaning. Whether you agree with it or not, there is a certain agenda and stance being pushed, by censoring and outright deleting various subs. The more attention you draw to this sub, the greater the likelihood that this sub itself will be taken down. Even if it's only a few bad posters. Even if the 136,990 other users are not like them.
  1. the single biggest reason why this sub has become so successful is because of you guys. We, the moderators, did not create or even guide the development of this sub into this vibrant, active community of pro-2A and pro gun people. You did. Not even five years ago, this sub was a tiny 10k subscriber community of mainly disgruntled r / guns users. Now it is where it is today. I don't want to see this sub turn into something it shouldn't be, because a handful of users wanted a policed sub like the other gun related ones.
  1. parallel to points 1 and 2, seeking a heavier hand in moderation means that content will not be dictated by the community, but by what moderators deem acceptable. I'm not sure if any of you were here about 3 years ago, but we had an incident in which there was essentially an attempt to dictate what you can and cannot say, based arbitrarily on what two mods thought they wanted to see.

As a moderator with admin privileges, I can do my best to try to vet limited mods as such, but I would much rather have the community self-police. If you need moderator assistance with regards to content that violates reddit rules (in a strict sense, I don't want to remove content that fits the rules but not your preferences), contact me directly.
post.title: Admins want to ban /r/Firearms for having a different moderation philosophy

body: Ruqqus does not keep live post and comment scores. Your votes do count, but they won't appear to affect the total score until the servers recalculate it again.
body_html: Ruqqus does not keep live post and comment scores. Your votes do count, but they won't appear to affect the total score until the servers recalculate it again.

guild.description:
The official guild for all things Ruqqus.

Rules:

💻 No promotion of other sites that aren't a fork of Ruqqus

🟪 Ruqqus-related only. This is a community dedicated to Ruqqus meta discussion. Content may involve technology and politics but must have ample context in Ruqqus.

📬 No spamming. Spamming comments or posts is not allowed.

😀 Be civil. Be nice. Harassment, trolling, and disruptive behavior is not allowed. Basically, don’t be a jerk.

📜 Follow Ruqqus ToS. This is a given.

For press releases, visit +RuqqusPress.

For updates and patch notes, visit +changelog.

For ideas and feedback, visit +BetaFeedback

For bug reports, visit +RuqqusBugs

post.body: If I upvote a post on the main page, but then open the link, it's not upvoted. I open the post and upvote in the link, but switch back to the main page, it's not upvoted there, I have to hit it again. I hope I explained that correctly. Glitch in the matrix?
post.body_html: If I upvote a post on the main page, but then open the link, it's not upvoted. I open the post and upvote in the link, but switch back to the main page, it's not upvoted there, I have to hit it again. I hope I explained that correctly. Glitch in the matrix?
post.title: Upvotes Not Showing on Threads When You Open the Thread
